field.label: Listen address
field.help: If possible, a loopback address is the safest choice here, you can forward traffic to it using the firewall.

field.label: Listen port
field.help: The port on which connections will be accepted.

field.label: Target hostname
field.help: The other end of this tunnel.

field.label: Target port
field.help: The port to forward traffic to.

field.label: Protocol
field.help: The application protocol to negotiate TLS.

field.label: Certificate
field.help: Select a certificate to use for this service.

field.label: CA to validate connections to
field.help: Select a Certificate Authority to validate connections to. To create a CA, go to CA Manager.

field.label: enable CRL
field.help:
Enable certificate revocation lists, when selected a CRL with the format XXXXXXXX.r0 is required in the chroot (/var/run/stunnel/certs/). When certificates are managed from this machine, the attached CRLs will be generated automatically. For more information about this option, see CRLpath in stunnels manual.
If configured and a valid CRL is not available, all connections will be denied. Additions may need a restart of stunnel (when the certificate was already used).

field.label: Client mode
field.help: Use client mode for this tunnel. Connect to an SSL server, do not act as an SSL server.
